message.content:
{"id": "3622", "title": "Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message", 
"description": "When invoking the New Package Wizard, a confusing message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message appears even if the package name field is empty. It is unclear what this message means and whether it indicates an error. Additionally, it is suggested that if this is an error, it should be displayed in red with the error icon. During testing, it was found that there should be no error message when the package name field is empty and the 'Finish' button should be disabled. It was also noted that the default package cannot be created by the user, as it is always present.", 
"OB": "When invoking the New Package Wizard, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' is displayed at the top, regardless of whether the package name field is empty or not. It is unclear what this message means and whether it indicates an error. Additionally, it is suggested to display this message in red with the error icon if it is indeed an error. Furthermore, when the package name field is empty, there should be no error message and the 'Finish' button should be disabled.", 
"EB": "When invoking the New Package Wizard, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should only be displayed if a non-empty package name is entered. If the package name field is empty, no message should be shown. If the message is shown, it should be styled in red with the error icon to indicate that it is an error. The 'Finish' button should also be disabled when the package name field is empty.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue: \n1. Create a new Java Project.\n2. Select the project.\n3. Invoke the New Package Wizard."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '3622', 'title': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)', 'description': 'Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O) ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: "A foldercorresponding to the package name already exists".At this point my package name fieldis empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed inred with the error icon?NOTES:EG (5/1/2001 5:53:41 AM)there should be no error message when the package name field is empty andfinish should be disabled.MA (5/2/01 9:34:00 AM)It is a warning.I will remove the messageEG (5/2/01 9:43:44 AM)issue how to create a default package?It can\'t be created by the user since it always there. ', 'SR': 'Create a new Java Project2. Select the project.3. '}
